parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From anti and the middle voice of echo; to hold oneself opposite to, i.e. adhere to; by extension to care for.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Teaching, doctrine, what is taught. From didasko; instruction.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: From hugies; to have sound health, i.e. Be well; figuratively, to be uncorrupt.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
(a) I reprove, rebuke, discipline, (b) I expose, show to be guilty. Of uncertain affinity; to confute, admonish.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To speak or say in opposition, contradict (oppose, resist). From anti and lego; to dispute, refuse.
